data.approach: Add CSS animations for scale-in-center and scale-out-center to TasksOpen.svelte. Apply scale-in animation when tasks appear (e.g., when a task becomes ready/open) and scale-out when tasks are being launched/removed. Will add the keyframes to app.css as utility classes per the IDE architecture.

summary: Added scale-in-center and scale-out-center keyframes to app.css with Animista-generated timing curves
Implemented task entrance tracking in TasksOpen.svelte to detect new tasks
Applied animate-scale-in-center class when tasks appear in the open tasks list
Applied animate-scale-out-center class when tasks are being spawned/launched
reviewFocus: Verify animations look good in browser when tasks appear and when spawning

summary: Added scale-in-center and scale-out-center keyframes to app.css with Animista-generated timing curves
Implemented task entrance tracking in TasksOpen.svelte to detect new tasks
Applied animate-scale-in-center class when tasks appear in the open tasks list
Applied animate-scale-out-center class when tasks are being spawned/launched
reviewFocus: Verify animations look good in browser when tasks appear and when spawning

summary: Added scale-in and scale-out CSS animations for task transitions
Implemented cubic-bezier animations for smooth visual feedback
Updated hooks and scripts to support animation implementation

suggestedTasks.title: Create Unit Tests for Task Transition Animations
suggestedTasks.description: Develop comprehensive unit tests for scale-in and scale-out CSS animations in the tasks module. Verify animation behavior across different browsers and screen sizes. Ensure animations trigger correctly during task state changes and do not interfere with core functionality.
suggestedTasks.reason: No existing tests cover the new animation implementation

suggestedTasks.title: Document CSS Animation Implementation Pattern
suggestedTasks.description: Create documentation explaining the new animation strategy for task transitions. Include details about the Animista-generated CSS, cubic-bezier curves, and how these animations enhance user experience. Add examples and best practices for future animation implementations.

patterns: Cubic-bezier curve configuration for smooth transitions
